data.Title: Google Confirms Core Updates Impact AI Overviews
data.Description: Google's John Mueller has confirmed that core updates impact the search engine's AI-powered overviews, meaning these overviews are subject to the same ranking fluctuations as traditional search results.

data.Title: Baidu Blocks Google and Bing From Scraping Content
data.Description: Baidu Baike, a Wikipedia-style service, has blocked Google and Bing's search engine crawlers from indexing its content. This move comes amid growing demand for data used in AI projects.

data.Title: Perplexity to Introduce Ads with CPM Model and Sponsored Questions
data.Description: AI search startup Perplexity plans to launch ads in Q4 2023 using a CPM model with prices starting at $50. Advertisers will be able to sponsor "related questions" within the platform.

data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update: Gains Vanishing, Impact Assessment
data.Description: Google's August 2024 core update, released on August 15th, was followed by a search ranking bug, creating confusion about their individual impacts. Some early gains seem to be vanishing. Google advises waiting until the update is fully rolled out before assessing its effects.

data.Title: Bing Image Search Introduces Refinement Cards
data.Description: Bing Image Search now features refinement cards within its results interface. These cards offer refinement options for search queries with example photos to guide users.

data.Title: Google Merchant Center Next Migration in September
data.Description: Google will migrate all merchants to Google Merchant Center Next in September 2024.

data.Title: Reddit's Advertising Strategy: Interest-Based Targeting and Projected Revenue
data.Description: Reddit is attracting advertisers with its interest-based targeting approach, leveraging its vast network of subreddits. The platform is projected to surpass $1.1 billion in ad revenue in 2024.

data.Title: No-Indexed Pages Don't Indicate Low Quality, Says Google
data.Description: Google's John Mueller clarifies that having a large number of no-indexed pages on a website does not necessarily signify low quality content. This statement addresses a common misconception among website owners.

data.Title: YouTube Dominates as the Most Popular Podcast Listening Platform in the US
data.Description: A recent study by Cumulus Media reveals that YouTube is the leading platform for podcast consumption in the United States, capturing 31% of respondents. Spotify follows with 21% and Apple with 12%.

data.Title: Bing Image Creator Adds Square-to-Landscape Resizing Feature
data.Description: Microsoft's Bing Image Creator now allows users to easily resize AI-generated images from square to landscape format, providing greater flexibility for content creation.

data.Title: Unanswered Comments Don't Impact Google Search Rankings
data.Description: Google's Martin Splitt confirms that unanswered comments on websites do not negatively affect search rankings. Google Search does not consider whether comments receive responses.

data.Title: Google Disputes Common SEO Audit Advice
data.Description: Google has questioned the validity of certain SEO audit recommendations provided by automated tools, suggesting that some advice may not be entirely accurate or beneficial.

data.Title: Google Antitrust Ruling Sparks Debate on AI Content Use
data.Description: A recent antitrust ruling against Google requires online publishers to explicitly consent to the use of their content for AI-generated search results, sparking debate about data rights and fair use.

data.Title: Google Search Console Data Persists After Domain Expiration
data.Description: Google warns that Search Console data remains accessible even after a domain expires, and there is no option to reset it. Temporarily removing the site from Search Console can hide data for expired domains.

data.Title: Google Launches New AI Crawler for Commercial Use
data.Description: Google has introduced a new web crawler specifically designed for its commercial AI customers. The company has also released documentation for website owners to monitor the crawler's activity on their sites.
